item.title: The Anantara Angkor Resort is now open again
item.description: Source: Anantara Angkor Resort website. View of the exterior. The luxurious Anantara Angkor Resort has reopened in Siem Reap, offering an all-suite boutique experience close to the wonders of the ancient Khmer Empire. Just a short drive from the city center, the 5-star resort provides easy access to vibrant markets, riverside attractions, and the charming French colonial quarter. The UNESCO World Heritage Site of Angkor Archaeological Park is also conveniently located a mere 10 minutes away.

item.title: The IMF has identified key policy priorities for Cambodia
item.description: An International Monetary Fund (IMF) team, led by Sonali Jain-Chandra, visited Cambodia from July 6 to July 20, 2016, for their yearly review of Cambodia’s economy. The team analyzed economic data and discussed policies with Cambodian government officials, business leaders, and other stakeholders. They concluded that Cambodia’s economy is strong, with high growth projected to continue due to exports, real estate, and construction. However, they cautioned that this growth could slow in the long term and emphasized the risk of financial instability from rapid credit growth, particularly in real estate.

item.title: In 2020, Canopy Power is making Southeast Asia more environmentally friendly
item.description: Source: Canopy Power. This image shows solar panels installed on the roof of a beachfront pavilion at Batu Batu resort. This installation was part of a larger project by Canopy Power. Despite the economic downturn of 2020, Canopy Power has announced several accomplishments within the Asia Pacific region. One such accomplishment was the completion of a renewable energy microgrid in the third quarter of 2020. This microgrid, located on Batu Batu, a sustainable island resort 16 km from Mersing, Malaysia, will allow the 22-villa resort to decrease its reliance on diesel and lower carbon emissions.

item.title: TripAdvisor has announced the winners of the Travelers' Choice awards for world landmarks
item.description: TripAdvisor, the popular travel website, has revealed the winners of its Travelersâ€™ Choice awards for top global attractions. Now in their second year, the awards recognized 929 attractions, with a special highlight on the top 25. Asian and Middle Eastern landmarks secured four spots in the global top ten, while an Australian park earned a coveted place among the top ten parks worldwide. Top 10 World Landmarks Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
